Sets options with choices to multiple products.
Calling this endpoint overrides any existing options assigned to given product.
Choice ids must be valid choices of the option passed.
If any option has generateVariants=true, variants must be provided as part of the request.
In case if all options has generate_variants=false, one default variant might be provided with empty `choices` list. If product already have such variant it can be omitted in request. Otherwise it must be provided.
The provided variants will override any existing variants on the product. If one of variants failed to be set entire product update will fail. However if update failed for single product other products still can be successfully updated, see `results.item_metadata` to know if specific product was updated successfully or not.
Please pay attention! In one request you can have up to 1000 variants in total for all products.
For example, you can set options for 100 products with up to 10 variants in each (100*10 = 1000) or for one product with 1000 variants.

Creates products in bulk. Support partial success.
Please pay attention! Each product must have at least one variant but in one request you can have up to 1000 variants in total for all products.
For example, you can create 100 products with up to 10 variants in each (100*10 = 1000) or one product with 1000 variants.
Permissions: Requires WIX_STORES.PRODUCT_CREATE, WIX_STORES.VARIANT_CREATE and WIX_STORES.INVENTORY_CREATE permissions.
If together with product you create other entities then you might need also WIX_STORES.BRAND_CREATE, WIX_STORES.RIBBON_CREATE, WIX_STORES.PRODUCT_OPTION_CREATE, WIX_STORES.INFO_SECTION_CREATE, WIX_STORES.MODIFY_SUBSCRIPTION_OPTIONS

params.name: products
params.doc: List of products to be updated.

docs.summary:
Bulk update up to 100 products. Can return partial success.
If you don't need to update product's `options`, variants and inventory you can stop reading.
description:
If product options updated and any option in request or in product before request had generateVariants=true then `item.variants` must be provided.
If `item.variants` provided they will replace all variants and inventory items for given product.
If you want to keep existing variant without changes provide variant `id` only.
If you want update existing variant provide `id` with new data.
If you don't want to update variants omit `variants` field.
Request accepts up to 1000 variants in total for all products. For example, you can update 100 products with up to 10 variants in each (100*10 = 1000) or one product with 1000 variants.

Permissions: Always requires WIX_STORES.PRODUCT_UPDATE. If you provide variants in request then you also need WIX_STORES.VARIANT_UPDATE and WIX_STORES.INVENTORY_UPDATE permissions.
If together with product you provide other entities then you might need also WIX_STORES.BRAND_CREATE, WIX_STORES.RIBBON_CREATE, WIX_STORES.PRODUCT_OPTION_CREATE or WIX_STORES.PRODUCT_OPTION_UPDATE, WIX_STORES.INFO_SECTION_CREATE or WIX_STORES.INFO_SECTION_UPDATE, WIX_STORES.MODIFY_SUBSCRIPTION_OPTIONS

Update a Product, supports partial update.
Pass the latest `revision` for a successful update.

description:
If product options updated and any option in request or in product before request had generateVariants=true then `item.variants` must be provided.
If `item.variants` provided they will replace all variants and inventory items for given product.
If you want update existing variant make sure to provide `id` with new data. If `id` field isn't provided then new variants with new ID will be created.
If you don't want to update variants omit `variants` field.
If you don't want to update inventory items for specific variants don't provide inventory items for it. If you provide at least one inventory item it will override all existing inventory items for this variant.
If any variant or inventory item update failed then entire request will fail.

Permissions: Always requires WIX_STORES.PRODUCT_UPDATE. If you provide variants in request then you also need WIX_STORES.VARIANT_UPDATE and WIX_STORES.INVENTORY_UPDATE permissions.
If together with product you provide other entities then you might need also WIX_STORES.BRAND_CREATE, WIX_STORES.RIBBON_CREATE, WIX_STORES.PRODUCT_OPTION_CREATE or WIX_STORES.PRODUCT_OPTION_UPDATE, WIX_STORES.INFO_SECTION_CREATE or WIX_STORES.INFO_SECTION_UPDATE, WIX_STORES.MODIFY_SUBSCRIPTION_OPTIONS

each variant must include all options of type generate_variants in `choices` field.
If one of variants failed to be created entire request will fail.
In case no option is set with generate_variants=true, one default variant must be provided with empty `choices` list.

members.name: entityEventSequence
members.doc:
A sequence number defining the order of updates to the underlying entity.
For example, given that some entity was updated at 16:00 and than again at 16:01,
it is guaranteed that the sequence number of the second update is strictly higher than the first.
As the consumer, you can use this value to ensure that you handle messages in the correct order.
To do so, you will need to persist this number on your end, and compare the sequence number from the
message against the one you have stored. Given that the stored number is higher, you should ignore the message.

Since platformized APIs only expose PATCH and not PUT we can't assume that the fields sent from the client are the actual diff.
This means that to generate a list of changed fields (as opposed to sent fields) one needs to traverse both objects.
We don't want to impose this on all developers and so we leave this traversal to the notification recipients which need it.

description:
The SEO schema object contains data about different types of meta tags. It makes sure that the information about your page is presented properly to search engines.
The search engines use this information for ranking purposes, or to display snippets in the search results.
This data will override other sources of tags (for example patterns) and will be included in the <head> section of the HTML document, while not being displayed on the page itself.
